Title: Posterior cingulate and retrosplenial cortex connections of the caudal superior temporal region in the rhesus monkey
Abstract: The rostral part of the superior temporal gyrus (STG) is known to project to ventral temporal cortex, but analogous paralimbic connections of the caudal STG have received comparatively less attention. The present study of the connections of the STG with medial paralimbic cortex showed that the caudal part of the STG (area Tpt and caudal area paAlt) and adjacent cortex of the upper bank of the superior temporal sulcus (caudal area TPO) have reciprocal connections with the caudal cingulate gyrus (areas 23a, b and c), retrosplenial cortex (area 30), and area 31. By contrast, cortex of the rostral-to-mid STG (areas Ts2, Ts3, and the rostral part of area paAlt) and adjacent upper bank of the STS (mid-area TPO) have few, if any, such interconnections. It is suggested that this connectional pattern of the caudal STG is consistent with its putative role of localizing sounds in space as proposed in recent studies

@Injections.Citation: "In case 1, the injection was on the crown of the gyrus, largely involving area Tpt with some spread of isotope in area paAlt."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "On the medial surface of the hemisphere, resulting foci of labeled terminal fibers were observed over the caudal cingulate gyrus and lower bank of the cingulate sulcus, within architectonic areas 23b, c and, to a lesser extent, 23a. Label was also found over area 31 and retrosplenial cortex at the rostral tip of the calcarine fissure (areas 29 and 30) (Fig. 4). "

@Injections.Citation: "In case 2, the injection involved the caudal portion of area Tpt as well as adjacent area paAc in the lower bank of the lateral sulcus."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "This injection produced terminal labeling on the medial surface of the hemisphere that was located over the caudal cingulate gyrus (area 23b), lower bank of the cingulate sulcus [areas 23c and PEci (Pandya and Seltzer 1982)] as well as area 31. Foci of label were also situated within retrosplenial cortex (area 30) dorsal to the splenium of the corpus callosum and in the banks of the rostralmost segment of the calcarine fissure (Fig. 2)."

@Injections.Citation: "In case 3, the injection was primarily in area Tpt, with some involvement of the adjacent caudal part of area paAlt in the STG. There was also minor spread to the lower bank of the STS (area V4t, Desimone and Ungerleider 1986; not shown on the lateral view in Fig. 3)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In this hemisphere, labeling was found in the caudal cingulate region (areas 23a, b and, to a lesser extent, 23c), area 31, and retrosplenial cortex (area 30). Additional terminal labeling was located in medial occipital cortex, corresponding to part of area V2 and area V1 in the upper bank and depth of the calcarine fissure (Fig. 3; the V2 and V1 projections probably due to spread of isotope into area V4t). "

@Injections.Citation: "Case 4 had an injection of radiolabeled amino acids in the caudal upper bank of the STS (area TPO) that spread into area Tpt. "

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In this monkey, medial hemispheric cortical labeling was seen in areas 23a and b, 31, and rostral sectors of V1 and V2 in and around the calcarine sulcus (Fig. 3)."

@Injections.Citation: "In case 5, the injection primarily involved middle-to-caudal segments of area TPO in the upper bank of the STS and lower part of the STG (area Ts3, equivalent to the “parabelt” area CPB of Hackett et al. 1998a), with some additional involvement of area Tpt (Fig. 5)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "This case displayed a moderate amount of labeling over areas 23a, b, and c and the sector of area 23 located around the splenium of the corpus callosum."

@Injections.Citation: "The injection in case 6, which primarily involved the middle portion of both the STG (areas Ts3 and paAlt) and upper bank of the STS (area TPO)"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The injection in case 6, which primarily involved the middle portion of both the STG (areas Ts3 and paAlt) and upper bank of the STS (area TPO), resulted in a small amount of labeling over area 23b and the retrosplenial sector of area 23 adjacent to area 30 (Fig. 5)."

@Injections.Citation: "In case 10, the injection involved the caudalmost part of area Tpt with some spread ventrally into the adjacent STS (areas TPO and MST) and dorsally into the caudal lateral sulcus (area paAc) and ventral part of the inferior parietal lobule (area PG)"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Resulting terminal labeling on the medial surface of the hemisphere was observed over caudal area 23c in the lower bank of the cingulate sulcus and, more caudally, area PEci corresponding to the supplementary somatic sensory area (Murray and Coulter 1981). There was also a focus of labeled terminal fibers over area PGm, but the remainder of the cingulate region and retrosplenial cortex (area 30) was devoid of label."

@Injections.Citation: "In case 11, the bulk of the injection was in the ventral inferior parietal lobule (area PG) with some spread into the caudalmost sector of the upper bank of the STS (areas TPO and MST)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "This injection resulted in terminal label in the cingulate gyrus at the junction of areas 23 and 24, and over area 31. There was also label over medial parietal [areas PEc, PEci, and PGm (Pandya and Seltzer 1982)] and medial occipital [areas PO, V2, and V3 (Felleman and Van Essen 1991)] cortex. "

@Injections.Citation: "The injection in case 23 was located at the border between areas paAlt and Tpt."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Resulting cells were noted in the retrosplenial sector of area 23, the caudal portion of the cingulate gyrus (areas 23a and b), and in dorsal and ventral sectors of area 30 (Fig. 7). "

@Injections.Citation: "Four other STG injections (cases 18–21) were placed more caudally, primarily in areas Ts3 and paAlt, but with some involvement of area Tpt in case 21."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "As shown in Fig. 7, which illustrates case 20, these injections produced retrogradely labeled cells in caudal cingulate areas 23a and b and the retrosplenial sector of area 23. Labeled neurons were also seen in dorsal and ventral sectors of area 30. "

@Injections.Citation: "Case 24 had an injection of FB in rostral area Tpt."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "On the medial surface of the hemisphere, labeled cells were encountered in areas 23a, b, and c and area 30 (Fig. 8). "

@Injections.Citation: "Finally, case 25, with a small injection of FB in the caudal portion of area Tpt,"

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Finally, case 25, with a small injection of FB in the caudal portion of area Tpt, produced labeling of cells in areas 23a, b and c, ventral and dorsal sectors of area 30, and area 31 (Fig. 8). "

publication.title: Posterior cingulate and retrosplenial cortex connections of the caudal superior temporal region in the rhesus monkey
publication.abstract: The rostral part of the superior temporal gyrus (STG) is known to project to ventral temporal cortex, but analogous paralimbic connections of the caudal STG have received comparatively less attention. By contrast, cortex of the rostral-to-mid STG (areas Ts2, Ts3, and the rostral part of area paAlt) and adjacent upper bank of the STS (mid-area TPO) have few, if any, such interconnections. It is suggested that this connectional pattern of the caudal STG is consistent with its putative role of localizing sounds in space as proposed in recent studies
